info.title: Home Assistant Events
info.description: This add-on fires custom events to Home Assistant that you can use in automations and scripts. All events include a timestamp field.

note.title: Usage:
note.description: Create automations in Home Assistant using these events as triggers. Access event data with trigger.event.data in your automation actions.

examples.title: Automation Examples
examples.description: Here are some practical examples of automations that respond to 1Password secret events:

secretsSynced.trigger: Fired after every successful synchronisation operation. Contains the list of changed secrets and groups.

secretWritten.trigger: Fired for each individual secret written to secrets.yaml during synchronisation.

secretAssigned.trigger: Fired when a secret is linked to a 1Password item through the UI.

secretUnassigned.trigger: Fired when a secret is unlinked from its 1Password item.

secretSkipToggled.trigger: Fired when a secret's visibility (hidden/shown) is toggled in the UI.

itemRefreshed.trigger: Fired when a 1Password item is manually refreshed, affecting all linked secrets.

groupUpdated.trigger: Fired when any secret in a group is updated. The {name} placeholder is replaced with your group name.

error.trigger: Fired when any error occurs during synchronisation, API calls, or operations.
